about: PSA Research is a research group at Northwestern University that studies Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), spatial computing, social computing, and the intersection of all three.
news: June 2017: Brent Hecht selected as Chair of ACM Future of Computing Academcy
Feb 2017: CSCW Presentation: Addressing article-as-a-concept assumption

projects.name: Tweet Geolocation
projects.description: We studied the biases present in both text and network based Tweet geolocation algorithms.

projects.name: Routing Algorithmic Externalities
projects.description: In this project, we identified externalities that arise when routing algorithms change behavior.

projects.name: Death by GPS
projects.description: We studied the dangerous effects of GPS failures.

opportunitiesText: We are currently looking for students excited about doing work at the intersection of human-computer interaction, spatial computing, and social computing. Undergraduate and graduate students who would like to join PSA Research should feel free to e-mail Brent directly. Please include a little bit about yourself (e.g. CV/resume, any past research experience, skills) and something about your research interests.
